verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%>,
How long will you trouble <S%H3013><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%>, and break <S%H1792><s%> me in pieces with words <S%H4405><s%>?
These ten <S%H6235><s%> times <S%H6471><s%> have you reproached <S%H3637><s%> me <S%H954><s%>: you are not ashamed that you make yourselves strange to me <S%H1970><s%>.
And be it indeed <S%H551><s%> that I have erred <S%H7686><s%>, my error <S%H4879><s%> remains with myself <S%H3885><s%>.
If indeed <S%H551><s%> you will magnify <S%H1431><s%> yourselves against me <S%H3198><s%>, and plead against me my reproach <S%H2781><s%>:
Know <S%H3045><s%> now <S%H645><s%> that God <S%H433><s%> has overthrown <S%H5791><s%> me <S%H5362><s%>, and has surrounded me with his net <S%H4686><s%>.
Behold <S%H6817><s%>, I cry out of wrong <S%H2555><s%>, but I am not heard <S%H6030><s%>: I cry aloud <S%H7768><s%>, but there is no judgment <S%H4941><s%>.
He has fenced up <S%H1443><s%> my way <S%H734><s%> that I cannot pass <S%H5674><s%>, and he has set <S%H7760><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> in my paths <S%H5410><s%>.
He has stripped <S%H6584><s%> me of my glory <S%H3519><s%>, and taken <S%H5493><s%> the crown <S%H5850><s%> from my head <S%H7218><s%>.
He has destroyed <S%H5422><s%> me on every side <S%H5439><s%>, and I am gone <S%H3212><s%>: and my hope <S%H8615><s%> has he removed <S%H5265><s%> like a tree <S%H6086><s%>.
He has also kindled <S%H2734><s%> his wrath <S%H639><s%> against me <S%H2803><s%>, and he counts me unto him as one of his enemies <S%H6862><s%>.

His troops <S%H1416><s%> come <S%H935><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>, and raise up <S%H5549><s%> their way <S%H1870><s%> against me <S%H2583><s%>, and encamp round about <S%H5439><s%> my tabernacle <S%H168><s%>.
He has put <S%H7368><s%> my brothers <S%H251><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from me <S%H3045><s%>, and my acquaintance are truly estranged from me <S%H2114><s%>.
My kinsfolk <S%H7138><s%> have failed <S%H2308><s%>, and my familiar friends <S%H3045><s%> have forgotten me <S%H7911><s%>.
They that live <S%H1481><s%> in my house <S%H1004><s%>, and my maids <S%H519><s%>, count <S%H2803><s%> me for a stranger <S%H2114><s%>: I am an alien <S%H5237><s%> in their sight <S%H5869><s%>.
I called <S%H7121><s%> my servant <S%H5650><s%>, and he gave me no answer <S%H6030><s%>; I entreated <S%H2603><s%> him with <S%H1119><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
My breath <S%H7307><s%> is strange <S%H2114><s%> to my wife <S%H802><s%>, though I entreated <S%H2589><s%> for the children <S%H1121><s%>'s sake of my own body <S%H990><s%>.
Yes <S%H5759><s%>, young sons despised <S%H3988><s%> me <S%H6965><s%>; I arose, and they spoke against me <S%H1696><s%>.
All my inward <S%H5475><s%> friends <S%H4962><s%> abhorred <S%H8581><s%> me <S%H157><s%>: and they whom I loved are turned against me <S%H2015><s%>.
My bone <S%H6106><s%> cleaves <S%H1692><s%> to my skin <S%H5785><s%> and to my flesh <S%H1320><s%>, and I am escaped <S%H4422><s%> with the skin <S%H5785><s%> of my teeth <S%H8127><s%>.
Have pity <S%H2603><s%> upon me <S%H2603><s%>, have pity upon me <S%H7453><s%>, O you my friends; for the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God <S%H433><s%> has touched me <S%H5060><s%>.
Why do you persecute <S%H7291><s%> me as God <S%H410><s%>, and are not satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with my flesh <S%H1320><s%>?
Oh that <S%H5414><s%> my words <S%H4405><s%> were now <S%H645><s%> written <S%H3789><s%>! oh that <S%H5414><s%> they were printed <S%H2710><s%> in a book <S%H5612><s%>!
That they were engraved <S%H2672><s%> with an iron <S%H1270><s%> pen <S%H5842><s%> and lead <S%H5777><s%> in the rock <S%H6697><s%> for ever <S%H5703><s%>!
For I know <S%H3045><s%> that my redeemer <S%H1350><s%> lives <S%H2416><s%>, and that he shall stand <S%H6965><s%> at the latter <S%H314><s%> day upon the earth <S%H6083><s%>:
And though after <S%H310><s%> my skin <S%H5785><s%> worms destroy <S%H5362><s%> this body <S%H1320><s%>, yet in my flesh shall I see <S%H2372><s%> God <S%H433><s%>:

Whom I shall see <S%H2372><s%> for myself <S%H5869><s%>, and my eyes shall behold <S%H7200><s%>, and not another <S%H2114><s%>; though my reins <S%H3629><s%> be consumed <S%H3615><s%> inside me <S%H2436><s%>.
But you should say <S%H559><s%>, Why persecute <S%H7291><s%> we him <S%H8328><s%>, seeing the root of the matter <S%H1697><s%> is found in me <S%H4672><s%>?

Be you afraid <S%H1481><s%> of the sword <S%H2719><s%>: for wrath <S%H2534><s%> brings the punishments <S%H5771><s%> of <S%H6440><s%> the sword <S%H2719><s%>, that you may know <S%H3045><s%> there is a judgment <S%H1779><s%>.
